title: examples
text: example use included dataset big5. ’s simulated students survey BIG 5 (Openness [O], Conscienciousness [C], Extraversion [E], Agreeableness [], Neuroticism [N]). scale comprises 21 items following structure BFIK. items originally presented German. See ?big5 translation details. Let’s look Extraversion scale first. First, must estimate model, case Partial Credit Model. use eRm-Package, however use one available packages well. ’s , now can use plotPIccc-function display model graphically many different ways. First, let’s look classical Person-Item Map, can also plotted using classical = TRUE.
code: dat_extra = big5[, c(1, 6, 11, 16)] res0 = PCM(dat_extra) plotPIccc(res0, classical = TRUE, extwin = FALSE)

title: examples
text: default, plotPIccc() draws Category Characteristic Curves (CCCs) items. Let’s look standard functionality first:  PIccc find four areas output: top left segment shows person parameter histogram. green line test information function (TIF) red line standard error (SE). top right segment holds legend. lower right segment shows category response frequency barcharts item. lower left segment important segment. shows item-related functions, case CCCs. plot highly customizable. example, wish just show person parameter histogram CCCs, can setting funwprop = 1. Use 0 just want show barplots right. way, can just show CCCs barplots without person parameters using funhprop = 1. can also use values 0 1 different proportions.  MEHR BEISPIELE UND DANN
code: plotPIccc(res0, extwin = FALSE) plotPIccc(res0, funwprop = 1, extwin = FALSE) plotPIccc(res0, funhprop = 1, extwin = FALSE)

title: examples
text: far looked one two modi plotPIccc function offers: plotting one type curve set items. many cases however, particular item merits closer examination. can simply setting isel argument desired item. Let’s look item “Q6” plot alle possible function types.  modus output looks slightly different . upper left segment still composed person parameter histogram well TIF SE. However, subset items used, dashed lines indicate TIF SE selected items. lower left segment now shows different functions item “Q6”. top right segment shows barplot item, lower right segment displays legends respective functions. course, every argument used can also used modus.
code: plotPIccc(res0, isel = "Q6", type = c("CCC", "TCC", "IIF", "CIF", "BIF"),           extwin = FALSE)

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: “Rasch wondered happened use graphs. think quite justified . used computers wrong way? Since Rasch retired active duty, emphasized power computers complicated calculations solving complicated equations power computers make nice illustrative graphs?” — Erling B. Andersen1

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: RMX package tool visualize various aspects Item-Response-Theory (IRT) models. major feature plotPIccc() function draws called “PIccc”. PIccc modified version classical Person-Item Map (also called Wright-Map). classical PI map person parameter distribution contrasted item parameters. However, item parameters shown simple dots. Furthermore, provide information models involving discrimination, guessing, laziness parameters. plotPIccc function overcomes restrictions several aspects. core plotPIccc function shows Person-Item confrontation using category characteristic curves (CCC, hence name PIccc diagram) also many functions, can help visualize different aspects IRT model.

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: additional information compared classical Person-Item Map flexible selection items dimensions flexible arrangement items accoding characteristics difficulty various graphical options support major IRT packages R (mirt, eRm, ltm, TAM psychotools)

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: plotPIccc() function supports two modi: drawing one type curve set items (default) drawing several types one item (providing vector types) Additionally can plot: test information function (TIF) entire set items (TIF=TRUE) TIF selected items (sTIF=TRUE) standard error (SE) items (SE=TRUE) SE selected items (sSE=TRUE) kernel density estimate (dens=TRUE)

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
code: library(RMX)  data(big5)  dat_extra = big5[,c(1,6,11,16)]  library(eRm)  res0 = PCM(dat_extra)  plotPIccc(res0)
